intro: Scleranthus fenzlii, commonly known as the Fenzli's thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and have a rough texture, while its flowers are often pink or purple in color. Scleranthus fenzlii is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
